description: Foundational set of forecasting examples for RAG

examples.title: Retail Daily Sales - Strong Weekly Seasonality
examples.description: E-commerce platform with 2 years of daily sales data. Strong weekly patterns (weekend spikes), holiday effects, and promotional impacts. 500+ daily observations.
examples.preprocessing_strategy: Date features (dow, month, is_holiday), median imputation, normalization. Prophet worked best due to strong seasonality and holiday effects.
key_lessons: Prophet excels with weekly seasonality and holiday effects
Add is_holiday feature for better promotional handling
Log transformation helped stabilize variance during promotions

examples.title: Stock Price Prediction - High Volatility
examples.description: Daily stock prices for tech company over 5 years. High volatility, trending behavior, and market regime changes. 1,250 observations.
examples.preprocessing_strategy: No imputation (no missing data), YeoJohnson for skewness, rolling window features. ARIMA with differencing for non-stationarity.
key_lessons: ARIMA with differencing handles non-stationarity well
Avoid imputation for financial data - missing = invalid
Rolling window features capture momentum patterns
Consider regime-switching models for structural breaks

examples.title: Energy Load Forecasting - Hourly Demand
examples.description: Electricity demand forecasting for utility company. Hourly data over 2 years with strong daily and weekly patterns. Weather dependency.
examples.preprocessing_strategy: Linear imputation for missing hours, date features (hour, dow, is_weekend), temperature interaction terms. Normalization essential.
key_lessons: XGBoost (boost_tree) best for complex hourly patterns
Temperature interaction with hour-of-day crucial
Neural networks (MLP) handle non-linear weather effects well
Separate models for weekday vs weekend can improve accuracy

examples.title: Manufacturing Production - Monthly Output
examples.description: Monthly production volumes for automotive plant. 10 years of data with economic cycle effects and capacity constraints.
examples.preprocessing_strategy: Date features (month, quarter), polynomial features (degree=2) for cycles. Capacity constraint as upper bound.
key_lessons: ARIMA captures economic cycles well
Polynomial features help model production ramp-up/down
Capacity constraints should be incorporated as upper bounds
Limited data (120 points) - simpler models better than complex

examples.title: IoT Sensor Monitoring - Minute-Level Temperature
examples.description: Industrial IoT temperature sensor data at 1-minute intervals. 6 months of data with equipment patterns and anomalies.
examples.preprocessing_strategy: Linear imputation for sensor gaps, rolling window features (10-min, 1-hour averages). Outlier removal critical.
key_lessons: High-frequency data benefits from aggregation (downsample to 5-10 min)
ARIMA effective for short-term predictions (next 10-30 mins)
Outlier removal essential before modeling
Consider anomaly detection separately from forecasting

examples.title: Hospital Patient Volume - Daily Admissions
examples.description: Daily patient admissions for regional hospital. 3 years of data with seasonal flu patterns and day-of-week effects.
examples.preprocessing_strategy: Date features (dow, month, is_holiday), Poisson regression for count data. Holiday calendar important.
key_lessons: Poisson regression appropriate for count data
Prophet handles flu season (winter peaks) well
Weekend effects significant - add dow feature
Holiday calendar reduces errors around major holidays

examples.title: Highway Traffic Volume - Hourly Counts
examples.description: Hourly vehicle counts on major highway. 1 year of data with strong commute patterns and weather effects.
examples.preprocessing_strategy: Date features (hour, dow, is_rush_hour), weather interaction. Linear imputation for sensor downtime.
key_lessons: Gradient boosting excels with complex hourly patterns
Rush hour indicator (7-9am, 5-7pm) highly predictive
Weather (rain, snow) significantly impacts volume
Separate models for weekday vs weekend recommended

examples.title: Crop Yield Prediction - Annual Harvest
examples.description: Annual wheat yield per acre over 20 years. Weather, soil quality, and farming practice variables.
examples.preprocessing_strategy: Weather aggregations (growing season avg temp, rainfall). Polynomial for soil nutrients. Very limited data - avoid overfitting.
key_lessons: Very limited data (20 years) - linear regression best
Random forest overfits with <30 observations
Weather during growing season most predictive
Cross-validation essential with limited data
